thread.title: Jess and Nick talk about their former relationship on “New Girl,” and now we’ve got lots of feelings
thread.title_full: Jess and Nick talk about their former relationship on “New Girl,” and now we’ve got lots of feelings

author: Rachel Paige
title: Jess and Nick talk about their former relationship on “New Girl,” and now we’ve got lots of feelings
text:
Jess and Nick talk about their former relationship on “New Girl,” and now we’ve got lots of feelings If you’ve ever broken up with someone before, you know it can be tough remaining friends after you both go your separate ways. Most of the time, you can’t be friends, so now try and imagine actually LIVING with your ex. That’s the situation Jess and Nick are still in on New Girl , and we’ve got to applaud them, they’re clear #ExGoals…even though we all secretly know these two are meant to be together and we are WAITING.
For the first time in a while, both Jess and Nick are in serious relationships. Jess is with the (near perfect in every way) Robbie and Nick is with the (falls asleep while reading fiction) Reagan. However, both feel like they’re subconsciously messing up their relationship, because they’re both a little too scared about getting ~serious~.
That’s when one ex looks to another ex for help. Good idea, or walking into a trap?
Fox Nick launches into a lil’ talk about how when things are good, they’re good, and that manes both he — and Jess! — freak out a little bit. He’s talking about their currently relationships, obviously…but he’s also touching on his history with Jess.
Jess even asks him, “Is that what happened with us?” AND OUR HEARTS.
Fox Nick follows up with joke, stating that he can’t even begin to figure out what happened between the two of them, and while these two then switch to talking about their current significant others, the signs are there. Clearly, there’s still a lot more left to discuss when it comes to the Jess and Nick dynamic, and we’ll be waiting right here to see where these two head next. Hopefully, it’s back to each other.
